intro: Senecio pichineuquensis var. pichineuquensis, commonly known as the Pichineuquén senecio, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, such as rocky slopes and grasslands. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces yellow to orange composite flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
